inclusion.criterion: Adult patients with cirrhosis and ascites
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: low protein content in the ascitic fluid (≤1.5 g/dL)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: deteriorated liver function (Child-Pugh score ≥B9, serum bilirubin level ≥3 mg/dL)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: impaired renal function (creatinine ≥1.2 mg/dL blood urea nitrogen level ≥25 mg/dL or hyponatremia ≤130 mEq/L)
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Previous use of antibiotics within the previous two weeks
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Previous GIT bleeding within one month
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: No murmurs or any other abnormalities are detected in the heart and lung auscultation.

exclusion.criterion: Resolving ascites for one month after diuretic therapy
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: Laboratory results are as follows: ... normal on palpation.

notes: Uncomplicated neonatal jaundice that may require phototherapy.
